newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Siemens ups stake in S.African operation.
newsitem.headline: Siemens ups stake in S.African operation.

text.p: Electronics company Siemens AG of Germany said on Monday it had acquired Sankorp's 32 percent stake in Siemens South Africa for an undisclosed sum.
Sankorp is a subsidiary of life assurance company Sanlam.
The Industrial Development Corporation would continue to retain its shareholding, Siemens AG said in a statement.

It said that to further facilitate Siemens position in all member countries of the Southern African Development Community (SADC), negotiations were underway to secure additional local partners who could share in the company's continued success.
SADC members are Mauritius, Angola, Lesotho, Swaziland, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Namibia, Mozambique, Tanzania, Namibia, South Africa and Malawi.
